verses.text: Then answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said,
How long wilt thou speak these \add things?\add* And \add how long shall\add* the words of thy mouth \add be like\add* a strong wind?
Doth God pervert judgment? Or doth the Almighty pervert justice?
If thy children have sinned against him, And he have cast them away for their transgression;
If thou wouldest seek unto God betimes, And make thy supplication to the Almighty;
If thou \add wert\add* pure and upright; Surely now he would awake for thee, And make the habitation of thy righteousness prosperous.
Though thy beginning was small, Yet thy latter end should greatly increase.
For inquire, I pray thee, of the former age, And prepare \add thyself\add* to the search of their fathers:
(For we \add are but of\add* yesterday, and know nothing, Because our days upon earth \add are\add* a shadow:)
Shall not they teach thee, \add and\add* tell thee, And utter words out of their heart?
Can the rush grow up without mire? Can the flag grow without water?
Whilst it \add is\add* yet in his greenness, \add and\add* not cut down, It withereth before any \add other\add* herb.
So \add are\add* the paths of all that forget God; And the hypocrite’s hope shall perish:
Whose hope shall be cut off, And whose trust \add shall be\add* a spider’s web.
He shall lean upon his house, but it shall not stand: He shall hold it fast, but it shall not endure.
He \add is\add* green before the sun, And his branch shooteth forth in his garden,
His roots are wrapped about the heap, \add And\add* seeth the place of stones.
If he destroy him from his place, Then \add it\add* shall deny him, \add saying\add*, I have not seen thee.
Behold, this \add is\add* the joy of his way, And out of the earth shall others grow.
Behold, God will not cast away a perfect \add man\add*, Neither will he help the evil doers:
Till he fill thy mouth \add with\add* laughing, And thy lips \add with\add* rejoicing.
They that hate thee shall be clothed with shame; And the dwelling place of the wicked shall come to nought.
